Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #31 - Keep going. Don't give up hope. You are doing a good job. Security is tough, and we often focus on the negative and forget to live in the moment and enjoy our victories. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #30 - Threat modeling applies to anything and everything. Threat modeling is part art and science. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #29 - Paved roads are platforms developers can build on top of without worrying about aspects like identity and access management.  #31AppSec

Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #28 - Guardrails allow devs to maintain their creativity and flexibility while building secure features. Guardrails provide a container and ensure the finished feature doesnâ€™t stray into the land of insecurity.  #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #27 - Developers are craftspeople and artisans who take great pride in writing secure code. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #26 - People think SBOM is the answer to all their security woes when it is just a step on a many-mile journey to security and privacy.  #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #25 - A lack of focus on secure by design results in issues sliding all the way to prod when they could have been squashed earlier. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #24 - Developers enter their field with little training/knowledge of AppSec. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #23 - Everyone equates tools = AppSec. AppSec is people, processes, tools, and governance.#31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #22 - Avoid the hamster wheel of scan and fix with your tools. Nobody gets ahead, and everybody keeps spinning. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #21 - Logging is always the forgotten step at the end of the various top ten lists. Let's bring logging one step closer to the top. #31AppSec

Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #20 - "Remember, leaving vulnerabilities in your code is like leaving your stapler in jello â€“ it might be funny at first, but you'll regret it when you need to get work done!" #31AppSec

Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #19 - Regularly update and patch third-party libraries and components. How can something so simple be so challenging to make a reality in a modern company? #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #17 - You miss 100% of the security patches you don't apply. So let's patch it up, people! #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #16 - Study a resource you've never dug into deeply and ponder the various new threats that are now possible inside your brain. #31AppSec

Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #13 - Find a person to mentor. Extend an offer to someone who might be too scared to ask you to mentor them. Ask your peers for recommendations on who is asking for mentorship. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #12 - Teach developers to use the OWASP Cheatsheet project as a reference for solving the most difficult of challenges in application security. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #11 - If your web app or SaaS doesn't support MFA and encourage users to enable it, schedule a meeting with a product manager TODAY. #31AppSec

Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #10 - Validate all input; trust but verify for input that moves inside the trust boundary; encode all output. Get a framework that does all this for you smoothly. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #9 - Always, always, always operate everything with the least amount of privilege needed to do the job. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #8 - Could we solve some of the software supply chain challenges by building a LetsEncrypt for open-source packages? #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #7 - Just in time (JIT) and Just Enough Access (JEA) are the pillars of any solid and secure access control mechanism. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #6 - Partnership between security and development is key. In the future, engineering and AppSec will be a single unit. #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #5 - Retrospective is a powerful tool that can be applied to any situation. Ask yourself, "Did we do a good enough job?" #31AppSec
Thirty-one days (and thoughts) on #AppSec - #4 - WAF is antiquated tech and provides the value of a firewall. IAST & RASP are the present and future. #31AppSec
